name: Apple
desc: Keeps the doctor away. Sure we have free health care, but that doesn’t mean we want to get lectured every 3 months about high cholesterol and healthy eating. It’s almost as bad as going to the dentist and being lectured about not flossing. Can also be fed to horses.

name: Banana
desc: It’s not easy being green. It’s also not easy eating green. When a banana is green, it’s not very ripe. Wait until it’s at least yellow all the way through with a few black spots. If if it gets to be too ripe, put it into your freezer and lie about how you’ll use it to make banana bread later.

name: Carrot
desc: Suitable for human and rabbit consumption. Legally we’re not allowed to say that this improves eye-sight, because this has been disproven. But don’t let science get in the way of achieving your dreams 20/20 vision. 1 carrot today could equal an illustrious career as a pilot tomorrow.

name: Milk
desc: Available in 3.25%, 2%, 1% and skim formats. Also in half and half. This laxative goes great with cereal or your morning/afternoon coffee.

name: Butter
desc: I can't believe it's not margarine. The sheer quantity of butter that Paula Deen uses when cooking has us wondering if she’s trying to kill her husband. How does one survive consuming that much butter? Regardless, feel free to purchase as much as you see fit. For cooking, or murder. We won’t judge.

name: Yogurt
desc: Market research has shown that women are the primary consumers of yogurt. That’s why yogurt commercials are inundated with women laughing at containers of yogurt. One time the Oxygen network ran the same yogurt commercial back to back, 12 times in a row. On purpose. Available in vanilla and strawberry.

name: Chicken
desc: It tastes like chicken because it is chicken. What else were you expecting? Corn fed, no antibiotics, given a first name and a long-fulfilling life. Even vegans could guiltlessly enjoy this poultry.

name: Salmon
desc: There’s a famous picture on the Internet of a salmon leaping into a bear’s mouth. Be the bear and devour this fish. Add some lemon. We promise that the particular salmon you're purchasing once swam up a waterfall.

name: Steak
desc: Not to be confused with the kind of stake Buffy liked to use. Best cooked medium rare. Anything more would be a sin. At least, that’s what the current culture tells us. Honestly just enjoy this steak however you prefer it. Not everyone wants to look down at their plate and see a hot bloody mess.

name: Whole White Bread
desc: Tastes like white bread but slightly more nutritious. Available in a loaf format, pre-sliced. Buy 12 and freeze 11 for later.

name: White Bread
desc: Devoid of almost any nutritional value, this bread is perfect for making sandwiches or attacking your digestive system with empty carbohydrates.

name: Gluten Free Bread
desc: The "GF" stands for "Gluten Free". But it could also stand for somethign else. Remember that glutten-free crazy from the late 2000s? It never really went away. Celiac disease is a serious issue that your uncle at Thanksgiving will never take seriously. Thankfully he never learned how to cook. So give this bread to your aunt and may all of the pain you experience be from your Uncle’s contradicting politics, and not a gluten allergy.

name: Oreo Cookies
desc: Palm oil based vanilla frosting, sandwiched in between two chocolate biscuits. At least, that’s how it started. Now there’s at least 20 different varieties. Rumor has it if you say the word “Lady Gaga Chromatica Orea Cookies,” you can hear the faint sound of Mr.Christie spinning in his grave.

name: Nacho Cheese Doritos
desc: Best served in a trough meant for feeding livestock, or as a makeup foundation for a US presidential campaign. Perfect for watching the Superbowl or being disgusting. Cheese sold separately.

name: Beef Jerky
desc: Because of recently passed legislation, we are no longer allowed to classify this product as “meat” and had to move it to our snack aisle instead. It’s like a salt lick, but meatier. Johnny Bravo would approve.
